intro: Borreria runkii, commonly known as the Mexican feverfew, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers and its aromatic, hairy leaves. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in dry, rocky soils. Borreria runkii is also valued for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in herbal remedies.
